abstract_summ: Here, we discuss current insights into the link between endothelial cells, viral infection and inflammatory changes and propose novel therapeutic strategies.We report the efficacy of therapeutic plasma exchange in severe COVID‐19 patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome.We outline such a patient who developed COVID-19 complicated by “cytokine storm” with severe ARDS and myocardial injury; and describe the challenges that arose during management.The results suggested TPE could be used as a strategy to attenuate circulating cytokines and inflammatory mediators.On the basis of emerging evidence from patients with COVID-19, we postulate that endothelial cells are essential contributors to the initiation and propagation of severe COVID-19.
